Binding to GPUs can be handled by the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment variable and binding to CPUs can be handled using the ‘—cpu-list’ argument to mpiexec. OpenMP-Offload on Polaris will work only if you use the prgenv-nvhpc environment, and the compilers in that environment. It will not work if one uses the gcc or Cray compilers.

Here is an example code:

===
/* Copyright (c) CSC Training */

#include <stdio.h>

#ifdef _OPENMP
#include <omp.h>
#endif

int main()
{
int num_devices = omp_get_num_devices();
printf("Number of available devices %d ", num_devices);

#pragma omp target
{
if (omp_is_initial_device()) {
printf("Running on host ");
} else {
int nteams= omp_get_num_teams();
int nthreads= omp_get_num_threads();
printf("Running on device with %d teams in total and %d threads in each team ",nteams,nthreads);
}
}

}
===

bramesh@polaris-login-02:> cc -mp= hello_opemp_offload.c

bramesh@polaris-login-02:> ./a.out
Number of available devices 0
Running on host
